title: 9 of Ukraine deadliest strikes that killed scores of Russians with a single blow US HIMARS and ATACMS take a toll
message:
Some Ukrainian strikes have killed scores of Russian troops with a single blow.
The UK Defense Ministry said on April 27, 2024, that it estimated 450,000 Russian troops had been killed or wounded since the start of the conflict.
The attack killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in one fell swoop, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach islandFootage uploaded by Ukraine of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar.
An unnamed Ukrainian official told the Kyiv Post that it was a "funny situation" because the Russian soldiers had made themselves sitting ducks.
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian strike kills scores of Russian troops
- UK Defense Ministry estimates 450,000 Russian troops killed or wounded
- Attack kills over 100 Russian soldiers
- Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach island
- Ukraine uploads footage of HIMARS strike on sandbar
- Ukrainian official describes Russian soldiers as sitting ducks

title: CENTCOM Report : US Drone Strike Killed Shepherd
message:
Following a yearlong investigation, United States Central Command has admitted that a U.S. drone strike in Syria last year killed a 56-year old shepherd and not a terrorist leader.
U.S. forces released a Hellfire missile near Masto’s home killing him and several of his sheep.
Central Command acknowledges and regrets the civilian harm that resulted from the airstrike.
We take all reports of civilian harm caused by U.S. military operations seriously and continue to employ thorough and deliberate targeting and strike processes to minimize civilian harm,” CENTCOM wrote in their press release.
“We are committed to learning from this incident and improving our targeting processes to mitigate potential civilian harm,” the report stated.
event_breakdown:
- U.S. drone strike in Syria killing a 56-year old shepherd
- Release of a Hellfire missile near Masto's home killing him and several sheep
- Acknowledgment and regret from Central Command regarding civilian harm
- Commitment to taking reports of civilian harm seriously and improving targeting processes

title: Israeli precision - guided munition likely killed group of children playing foosball in Gaza , weapons experts say - LocalNews8 . com
message:
“My soul is gone.”In the two weeks since the attack, the Israeli military’s statements have shifted, but it has not taken responsibility for the strike that ultimately killed Shahed and 10 other children.
An analysis of the site of the attack, documented by a freelance journalist working for CNN in Gaza, paints a very different picture of Israeli military responsibility.
Cobb-Smith said he believed there was “no question” that an Israeli munition was used in the attack, saying Palestinian militants “do not have anything with this amount of sophistication” in their arsenal.
Israeli military’s shifting responseCNN has pressed the Israeli military for details about the strike, which took place on April 16 at about 3:40 p.m., according to video evidence.
The Israeli military declined to provide any additional evidence to back up its claims.
event_breakdown:

2. Israeli military's statements regarding the attack have shifted, but they have not taken responsibility for it.
3. A freelance journalist working for CNN in Gaza documented the site of the attack and suggested Israeli military responsibility.
4. Analysis by Cobb-Smith indicated that an Israeli munition was used in the attack, as Palestinian militants lack such sophisticated weaponry.
5. Israeli military declined to provide additional evidence to support their claims despite pressure from CNN.

title: 2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civilians
message:
2 Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civiliansBy VOA News May 02, 2024Two Nigerian military officers will face a court martial over a December drone strike that killed at least 85 civilians, the Defense Headquarters said on Thursday.
The Nigerian military acknowledged the drone accidentally struck a village in northwest Kaduna State, killing residents as they celebrated a Muslim festival.
The military depends on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in the northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in the northwest.
"The military has conducted a painstaking investigation into the incident and has initiated disciplinary action against those culpable," he said.
The United Nations human rights office said the drone strike was the latest of at least four airstrikes since 2017 that caused significant civilian fatalities.
event_breakdown:
- Two Nigerian military officers to face court martial over drone strike that killed civilians in northwest Kaduna State
- The drone strike accidentally struck a village during a Muslim festival, resulting in at least 85 civilian deaths
- Nigerian military relies on aerial assaults to combat Islamic militants in the northeast and armed kidnapping gangs in the northwest
- United Nations human rights office reports at least four airstrikes since 2017 with significant civilian fatalities

title: US airstrike targeting al - Qaida leader in Syria killed a farmer , American military says
message:
A US airstrike in Syria in May 2023 that was targeting an al-Qaida leader killed an innocent civilian instead, US Central Command said Thursday, confirming early reports from residents and family members shortly after the attack.
US Central Command said an investigation into the May 3 strike concluded that US forces misidentified the intended al-Qaida target "and that a civilian, Mr. Lufti Hasan Masto, was struck and killed."
Central Command said the investigation into the strike was completed last November — but it wasn't released publicly until Thursday.
In a statement, Central Command said much of the investigation and findings are classified but acknowledged it revealed "several issues that could be improved."
The US also continues to target al-Qaida and Islamic State leaders in Syria, including the 2017 airstrike that killed Abu al-Kheir al-Masri, a former aide to Osama bin Laden and al-Qaida's second in command in Syria.
event_breakdown:
- US airstrike in Syria in May 2023, targeting an al-Qaida leader, resulted in the unintended killing of an innocent civilian, Mr. Lufti Hasan Masto, according to US Central Command.
- Central Command's investigation concluded that US forces misidentified the intended target.
- The investigation into the strike was completed in November but was only publicly released on Thursday.
- Central Command acknowledged "several issues that could be improved" based on the investigation findings.
- The US continues to target al-Qaida and Islamic State leaders in Syria, as demonstrated by previous strikes including the 2017 airstrike that killed Abu al-Kheir al-Masri, a former aide to Osama bin Laden and al-Qaida's second in command in Syria.

title: Explosion at DRC displaced person camp kills at least 9
message:
Local officials and media reports in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo say at least nine people – most of them children – were killed Friday following an explosion or explosions at displaced persons camp in the eastern city of Goma.
From his X social media account, DRC journalist Daniel Michombero reported an explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma.
Witnesses and local officials reported seeing at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
A local hospital official told the French news agency AFP the facility had received 32 wounded and four bodies.
In a statement on his official X account, DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blamed the Rwandan army and its “terrorist auxiliaries” the M23 rebels for the attack.
event_breakdown:
- Explosion(s) at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma, eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, reported by DRC journalist Daniel Michombero.
- At least nine people, mostly children, killed in the explosion(s) according to local officials and media reports.
- Witnesses and local officials report at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
- A local hospital receives 32 wounded and four bodies, as reported by a hospital official to the French news agency AFP.
- DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blames the Rwandan army and its "terrorist auxiliaries" the M23 rebels for the attack in a statement on his official X account.

title: Armies need their own drone air force flown by specialist soldiers , study says
message:
The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
This would include "situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance; tactical strike UAVs; ISR [reconnaissance] UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth; operational strike UAVs; and platform-launched effects designed specifically to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems."
To support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy, flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
"It therefore makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex," the report concluded.

title: Armies need their own drone air force flown by specialist soldiers , study says
message:
The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
This would include "situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance; tactical strike UAVs; ISR [reconnaissance] UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth; operational strike UAVs; and platform-launched effects designed specifically to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems."
To support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy, flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
"It therefore makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex," the report concluded.
event_breakdown:

- RUSI envisions equipping each drone battalion with various UAV capabilities, including situational awareness UAVs for tactical reconnaissance, tactical strike UAVs, ISR UAVs for penetrating operational depth, operational strike UAVs, and platform-launched effects to synchronize with other weapons systems.

title: Journalist , 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote - controlled blast in Khuzdar
message:
Journalist, 2 others killed after vehicle hit with remote-controlled blast in KhuzdarRemote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on National HighwayMohammad Siddiq Mengal car is seen damaged following the blast on May 3, 2024, in this still taken from a video.
KHUZDAR: Mohammad Siddiq Mengal, a journalist and president of the Khuzdar Press Club, was killed along with two others on Friday after a remote-controlled bomb targeted his vehicle in Khuzdar, police told Geo News.
The killed passers-by were seriously injured in the remote-controlled blast and were brought to the hospital, while the other eight injured in the blast are undergoing treatment in different hospitals, police said.
According to the police, the remote-controlled blast was carried out on the Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road on the National Highway.
The station house officer said that the journalist's vehicle was the target of the blast and was hit when he was going to university from his home.
event_breakdown:
- Remote-controlled blast on Sultan Ibrahim Khan Road, National Highway in Khuzdar
- Mohammad Siddiq Mengal, journalist and president of Khuzdar Press Club, killed in the blast
- Two others killed in the blast
- Passers-by seriously injured and brought to the hospital
- Eight others injured in the blast undergoing treatment in different hospitals

title: Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike near Damascus
message:
Syrian defence ministry claimed on Friday that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
The Times of Israel citing Syrian state-run broadcaster said the strike caused "material losses."
Israeli warplanes launched their missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site in the area of the capital, the Syrian defence ministry said according to the Syrian Arab News Agency.
Also Russian state media TASS quoted Dubai-based Al Hadath TV as saying that the attack targeted a base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, located southwest of Damascus International Airport.
There was no official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
event_breakdown:
- Israeli airstrike near Damascus injures eight Syrian soldiers, according to the Syrian defence ministry.
- The strike causes "material losses," as reported by Syrian state-run broadcaster, cited by The Times of Israel.
- Israeli warplanes launch missiles from over the Golan Heights targeting a site in the capital area, states the Syrian defence ministry, reported by the Syrian Arab News Agency.
- The attack targets a base of Lebanon's Shia militia, Hezbollah, southwest of Damascus International Airport, according to Dubai-based Al Hadath TV, quoted by Russian state media TASS.
- There is no official confirmation by Israeli authorities regarding the reported reprisal strike.

title: Moment more than 100 of Putin troops  are wiped out  in long - range strike with newly supplied US ATACMS ballistic missile
message:
This is the moment more than 100 Russian troops are believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk.
A military training ground was seen being hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike in footage captured by a drone flying high above.
Footage of the recent attack appears to show the training ground as one such target.
Over the area where the Russian soldiers were seen seconds earlier, hundreds of flashes of smoke are seen erupting over the clearing.
These flashes, according to analysts, were the M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating on the training ground, killing many of the Russian troops gathered there.
event_breakdown:
- More than 100 Russian troops were believed to have been killed in an ATACMS tactical ballistic missile strike on occupied Luhansk
- A military training ground was hit by multiple explosions typical of an ATACMS strike, captured in footage by a drone
- Footage of the recent attack shows the training ground as a target
- Flashes of smoke erupted over the clearing, believed to be M74 APAM mini-bombs detonating and killing many Russian troops gathered there

title: Looking back at history : events from May 1924 - Oakdale Leader
message:
The month of May has been home to many historical events over the years.
Iodized salt is introduced in the United States on May 1.
Ludendorff ran under the banner of the National Socialist Freedom Movement, which was standing in for the banned Nazi Party.
On the day of her death, Lyons allowed three men into her home, likely hoping to rehabilitate them.
The United States Border Patrol is created on May 28 to prevent illegal entry into the United States from Mexico and Canada.
event_breakdown:
- Introduction of iodized salt in the United States on May 1
- Ludendorff running under the National Socialist Freedom Movement banner
- Lyons allowing three men into her home on the day of her death
- Creation of the United States Border Patrol on May 28 to prevent illegal entry from Mexico and Canada

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 03 May 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10x settlements, including Makiivka, Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka and New York (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces launched air strikes in the vicinities of Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, Karlivka (Donetsk oblast).
event_breakdown:
- Ukraine is attacked by land, naval, and air forces of Russia on February 24, 2022, sparking the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
- Russian forces fire artillery and mortars at over 10 settlements, including Makiivka, Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, and Yampolivka (Donetsk oblast).
- Russian forces launch air strikes in the vicinities of Verkhn'okam'yans'ke, Spirne, Ivano-Dar'ivka, and New York (Donetsk oblast).
- Russian forces also launch air strikes in the vicinities of Vovche, Kalynove, Zhelanne, Vesele, Novoselivka Persha, Komyshivka, and Karlivka (Donetsk oblast).

title: Rafah offensive and war in Gaza : Threat of a dangerous escalation
message:
Rafah and RegionWithin the region, there is apprehension about the Rafah offensive.
In case of the Rafah offensive going ahead, there is all likelihood that the engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel will grow.
ConclusionLike the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, the Rafah offensive too threatens to escalate the conflict if launched.
While the Iran-Israel spat was short, the Rafah offensive could spread very fast.
The only face-saving exit for either of the parties is an early and long lasting ceasefire in Gaza before any offensive in Rafah.

title: Australian Muslims claim  double standard  in police handling of hate crime incidents – International Shia News Agency
message:
Shafaqna English- Australian Muslims claim ‘double standard’ in police handling of hate crime incidents, ead of the Australian National Imams Council (ANIC) said.
An April 13 knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia killed six people before police killed the attacker.
Days later, Australian police said the attacker had mental health problems that led to the isolated act and that the attack was not related to terrorism.
“One was described as a mental health issue, the other one was labeled a terrorist act.
Emphasizing that the language used by police did not help the situation, Al-Suleiman said they conveyed their concerns about a double standard to authorities but got unsatisfactory feedback.
event_breakdown:
- Australian Muslims claim ‘double standard’ in police handling of hate crime incidents
- Knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia on April 13 kills six people
- Police kill the attacker in the Sydney mall
- Australian police state the attacker had mental health problems and the attack was not related to terrorism
- Head of the Australian National Imams Council (ANIC) criticizes police language and response to the incidents

title: Ukraine wiped out 100 Russian troops at once in a strike showcasing the range and power of its new US ATACMS
message:
Ukrainian forces took out more than 100 Russian soldiers with an ATACMS missile, per OSINT analysts.
AdvertisementA Ukrainian ATACMS long-range missile strike killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Osinttechnical said at least one of the missiles struck a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them.
The US had previously sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine, but the versions sent recently can travel about 190 miles — which puts higher-value targets in Ukraine's crosshairs.
The US sent Ukraine ATACMS with a shorter range last fall, which enabled Ukraine to destroy Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines, but not go after more distant targets.
location: Occupied region 50 miles from the front line
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian forces conducted a long-range missile strike using an ATACMS missile, killing more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line
- The missile strike was reported by OSINT and military analysts
- OSINT analysts at Osinttechnical confirmed that at least one of the missiles struck a gathering of over 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them
- The US had previously sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine last fall, allowing them to target Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines
- Recently, the US sent Ukraine ATACMS missiles with a range of about 190 miles, putting higher-value targets within Ukraine's reach

title: Teenagers and terrorism : What is being done ?
message:
AdvertisementNor is the link yet clear between the six charged this week and the church attacker, though one described him as a “mate”.
They had comprised half of ASIO’s “priority counter-terrorism caseload” just a couple of years ago, and “it’s picked up again”, he said.
ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess told the press club that young terror suspects were not a new problem.
Muslim leaders have slammed authorities for not exploring alternatives to the counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
The speed with which police designated the church stabbing a terrorist incident, just hours after it occurred, remains another source of grievance.
event_breakdown:
- Six individuals were charged this week, with a connection to a church attacker.
- These individuals were part of ASIO's priority counter-terrorism caseload in the past.
- ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess mentioned that young terror suspects have been a longstanding issue.
- Muslim leaders criticized authorities for not considering alternatives to counter-terrorism raids in Sydney.
- Police quickly labeled the church stabbing as a terrorist incident shortly after it happened.

title: Progress in Gaza cease - fire talks , but little chance of ending war
message:
Hamas has called for a complete end to the war and withdrawal of all Israeli forces from Gaza.
A senior Israeli official, speaking on condition of anonymity to discuss ongoing negotiations, played down the prospects for a full end to the war.
Israeli strikes early Saturday on Gaza killed at least six people.
A strike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza killed three people, according to hospital officials.
Once inside Gaza, the convoy was commandeered by Hamas terrorists, before UN officials reclaimed it.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas calls for complete end to war and Israeli withdrawal from Gaza.
- Senior Israeli official downplays prospects for full end to war.
- Israeli strikes in Gaza kill at least six people, including three in Nuseirat refugee camp.
- Convoy entering Gaza is commandeered by Hamas terrorists before being reclaimed by UN officials.

title: Iran IRGC Warship Shahid Mahdavi Makes History by Sailing into Southern Hemisphere – Al - Manar TV Lebanon
message:
The Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Navy’s indigenous warship Shahid Mahdavi has made history by crossing the Equator and entering the Southern Hemisphere.
Iranian officials emphasize that the country’s defense capabilities, including missile power, are solely for defensive purposes and are not up for negotiation.
Imam Sayyed Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader, has consistently emphasized the importance of strengthening the country’s defense capabilities to ensure national security.
As the Shahid Mahdavi continues its journey in the Southern Hemisphere, Iran’s commitment to self-sufficiency in defense technology remains unwavering.
The IRGC’s oceangoing warship represents a significant achievement in Iran’s efforts to bolster its military readiness and protect its sovereignty.
event_breakdown: There are no events in the text provided that involve the designation or information about a terrorist organization.

title: Security forces kill six terrorists in North Waziristan IBO
message:
— AFPSix terrorists were killed by the security forces following an intense gun battle during an intelligence-based operation (IBO) in North Waziristan district, Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said Saturday.
During the conduct of the operation, intense fire exchange took place between the troops and the terrorists, as a result of which six terrorists were "sent to hell".
The killed terrorists remained actively involved in numerous terrorist activities against security forces as well as target killings of innocent civilians in the area.
Security forces on Thursday killed terrorists involved in the recent abduction of district and sessions judge of South Waziristan in a joint IBO in KP's Tank district, the ISPR had said in a statement.
Among the 432 fatalities, 281 included that of civilians and security forces personnel.
event_breakdown:
- Six terrorists killed in an intense gun battle during an intelligence-based operation (IBO) in North Waziristan district, according to Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR).
- Intense exchange of fire occurs between security forces and terrorists during the operation, resulting in the death of six terrorists.
- The killed terrorists were actively involved in various terrorist activities against security forces and target killings of civilians in the area.
- Security forces kill terrorists involved in the recent abduction of a district and sessions judge of South Waziristan in a joint IBO in KP's Tank district, as stated by the ISPR.
- Among the 432 fatalities, 281 are civilians and security forces personnel.

title: USS Cole Anniversary Today : Media Silent
message:
On this day in the year 2000, the guided missile destroyer USS Cole was attacked by Islamic terrorists associated with Osama bin Laden's al-Quaeda group.
Today is the seventh anniversary of that attack.
The most recent example occured in 1968 when North Korea attacked the USS Pueblo.
Yet not a single media organ seems to care that Americans were attacked and killed.
The USS Pueblo was attacked and captured by North Korea, not North Vietnam.
event_breakdown:
1. On this day in the year 2000, the guided missile destroyer USS Cole was attacked by Islamic terrorists associated with Osama bin Laden's al-Qaeda group in Aden, Yemen.
2. Today marks the seventh anniversary of the USS Cole attack in Aden, Yemen.
3. In 1968, North Korea attacked and captured the USS Pueblo in the Sea of Japan.

title: Israelis urged to flood the streets and demand the release of hostages :  Rafah can wait , says Ex PM Olmert – Ya Libnan
message:
“The talk of total victory” over Hamas was an empty slogan”, the wrote.
By Ehud Olmert, former prime minister of IsraelAfter more than six months of hybrid warfare – in the air, on land and underground – it’s possible to conclude that the bulk of Hamas’ military power has been dismantled.
He knew talk of “total victory” over Hamas was an empty slogan.
Rafah is not a crucial objective that would decide the outcome of the fighting between Israel and Hamas.
In this respect, it seems that in Netanyahu’s worldview, the country’s biggest enemies are the most fearless and daring of Israel’s soldiers and members of the elected opposition in the Knesset.

title: Iranian - Made Cruise Missile Crashes in Somalia , No Casualties Reported
message:
TALEEX, Somalia (Horseed Media) – An apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s Sool region late Thursday night, according to witness accounts and visual evidence from the scene, though no casualties have been reported.
Debris an apparent Iranian-made cruise missile crashed in Somalia’s SoolResidents of Taleex district described hearing a loud explosion around midnight, with wreckage discovered in the morning bearing resemblance to an Iranian Quds land-attack cruise missile (LACM).
No group has claimed responsibility for the apparent cruise missile launch violating Somali airspace.
“These actions are taken to protect freedom of navigation and make international waters safer and more secure for US, coalition, and merchant vessels,” CENTCOM said in a statement.
No casualties have been reported in Somalia from the apparent failed cruise missile strike.

title: Gaza : 54 Palestinians killed , 102 injured by Israeli bombardments last 48hrs - The Muslim News
message:
Gaza City, (Al Jazeera, Wafa, AA): Between the afternoons of 1 and 3 May, according to the Ministry of Health (MoH) in Gaza, 54 Palestinians were killed and 102 others injured by indiscriminate bombings by Israeli Defence Forces in Gaza Strip.
Israel’s attacks have so far directly caused $33 billion of damage in the Gaza Strip, it said.
Meanwhile, nine more civilians were injured in another Israeli strike on the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
Meanwhile, nine more civilians were injured in another Israeli strike on the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip.
[Photo: Children in Rafah city queue to receive a bowl of food for their families from charity organizations, in Rafah, Gaza on 03 05 2024.

- Nine civilians were injured in an Israeli strike on the Bureij refugee camp in the central Gaza Strip

title: Haunted by their colleague deaths : The journalists risking their lives to report from Gaza
message:
Gazan journalists told CNN they are haunted by their colleagues’ deaths, as they balance the emotional labor of covering the war with trying to protect their families.
Israel launched a military assault on Gaza on October 7 after the militant group Hamas, which governs Gaza, killed at least 1,200 people in Israel and abducted more than 250 others.
After nearly seven months of war, Abu Dagga told CNN that she, too, wants to leave.
The photojournalist for Turkish state broadcaster TRT told CNN he had been traveling through the neighborhood, after being displaced from the local refugee camp.
“This was a huge burden on me,” Dahman, 36, told CNN last month.

title: Russia Says It Killed Ukrainian Agent Plotting  Terrorist  Acts : Report
message:
The man was planning to attack a fuel depot in the Leningrad region.
(Representational)Russia's FSB security service said on Friday it had killed a man recruited by Ukraine to blow up military buildings and energy sites in Russia, state media reported.
The FSB said on Friday it had "neutralised" a man who had "planned to commit a series of terrorist acts in Russia", Russian state-run news agencies quoted an FSB statement as saying.
These, it said, included attacks "against defence ministry facilities in the Moscow region and against members of a volunteer battalion and a volunteer centre in Saint Petersburg".
The man was planning to attack a fuel depot in the Leningrad region, the FSB alleged.

title: Eight Syrian soldiers injured in Israeli airstrike - News Today
message:
Syrian defense ministry claimed on Friday that eight Syrian soldiers were injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus.
The Times of Israel citing a Syrian state-run broadcaster said the strike caused “material losses.”Israeli warplanes launched their missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site in the area of the capital, the Syrian defense ministry said according to the Syrian Arab News Agency.
Following this development, US media reported that Israel had carried out overnight airstrikes against Israel after which Iran fired air defense batteries and shut down flight operations in several cities including Tehran, Shiraz and Isfahan that was later lifted.
There was no official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
Meanwhile, The US Department of Defence said that a drone strike in the year 2023 in Syria, initially said to have successfully targeted an al-Qaeda leader, actually killed a farmer, Washington Post reported from the summary of an internal investigation done by the Pentagon released on Thursday (US local time).
event_breakdown:
- Eight Syrian soldiers injured in an Israeli airstrike near Damascus, according to the Syrian defense ministry.
- Israeli warplanes launch missiles from over the Golan Heights at a site near the capital, as reported by Syrian state-run broadcaster citing the Syrian defense ministry.
- US media reports Israel carried out overnight airstrikes against Syria, followed by Iran firing air defense batteries and shutting down flight operations in cities like Tehran, Shiraz, and Isfahan, later lifted.
- No official confirmation by Israeli authorities on the reported reprisal strike.
- The US Department of Defense reveals that a drone strike in Syria in 2023, initially targeting an al-Qaeda leader, actually killed a farmer, based on an internal investigation released by the Pentagon, reported by the Washington Post.

message:

The canal began construction on May 4, 1904.
In 1904, construction began on the Panama Canal.

title: Explosions rock Kharkiv as Russia strikes it with guided aerial bombs , one person reported dead
message:
Russian forces attacked the Kholodnohirsky district of Kharkiv with guided bombs, leaving one woman dead, two people wounded, while someone may still be under debris, Kharkiv regional governor Oleh Synehubov wrote on Telegram on May 3.
Read also: Russian bombs hit Kharkiv residential areaSynehubov added that strike caused a fire in a private house.
Read also: At least one dead, seven injured as Russia attacks Kharkiv with guided aerial bombsHe later said that private sector of Kharkiv was hit, several buildings were destroyed, and people are trapped under rubble.
Ukrainian Air Force also warned about Russian guided aerial bombs in Kharkiv Oblast.
Russian strikes on Kharkiv and Kharkiv OblastRecently, strikes on Kharkiv and the oblast has become more frequent.
event_breakdown: There are no events in the provided text that involve the designation or information about a terrorist organization.

title: Nigerian Military Should Provide Details of Investigation into Deadly Airstrike
message:
The Nigerian military authorities said this week they had completed investigations into an erroneous Army airstrike in Tundun Biri Community, Kaduna state, which killed 85 people and injured dozens more in December 2023.
While this announcement may mark progress towards accountability, authorities should provide answers to many of the outstanding questions about the investigation.
Following the Tundun Biri airstrike in December, army authorities claimed responsibility for the incident and apologized to the community, while Nigeria’s president, Bola Ahmed Tinubu, ordered an investigation to be carried out.
Human Rights Watch documented the loss, devastation, and trauma resulting from the December airstrike as well as a prior erroneous airstrike by the Air Force in January 2023, which killed 39 people.
Far too many people have been killed by erroneous airstrikes by the Nigerian military.
event_breakdown:
1. Nigerian military authorities completed investigations into an erroneous Army airstrike in Tundun Biri Community, Kaduna state, killing 85 people and injuring dozens in December 2023.
2. Army authorities claimed responsibility for the Tundun Biri airstrike and apologized to the community in December 2023.
3. Nigeria's President, Bola Ahmed Tinubu, ordered an investigation into the Tundun Biri airstrike in December 2023.
4. Human Rights Watch documented loss, devastation, and trauma from the December airstrike and a prior erroneous airstrike by the Air Force in January 2023, which killed 39 people.

title: For decades , Moscow has sought to silence its critics abroad
message:
A Soviet agent attacked Trotsky in 1940 with an ice axe, mortally wounding him.
Security expert Andrei Soldatov said the work of the Kremlin's intelligence services, then and now, has been defined by threats from dissidents abroad.
That's how it caught Sidney Reilly, a Ukrainian-born agent who worked for Britain both inside Russia and abroad.
He was befriended there by Ramon Mercader, who pretended to be sympathetic to Trotsky's ideas but in reality was a Soviet agent.
While living in exile in Munich in 1959, Bandera, 50, was killed after being confronted by a Soviet agent with a gun that sprayed cyanide.
event_breakdown:
- Soviet agent attacked Trotsky with an ice axe in 1940 
- Sidney Reilly, a Ukrainian-born British agent, caught by Kremlin's intelligence services 
- Ramon Mercader, a Soviet agent, befriended Trotsky 
- Bandera killed by a Soviet agent in Munich in 1959

title: Russian attacks cause casualties in three Ukraine regions
message:
Russian attacks cause casualties in three Ukraine regionsWorld World Russian attacks cause casualties in three Ukraine regionsRussian attacks cause casualties in three Ukraine regionsFollow on Published On: Sat, 04 May 2024 23:19:52 PKTKYIV (Reuters) - Russian attacks on Ukraine's Kharkiv and Dnipro regions and the Black Sea port city of Odesa killed at least two civilians, injured others and damaged critical infrastructure, homes and commercial buildings, regional officials said on Saturday.
Oleh Synehubov, governor of Kharkiv region, said Russian shelling killed a 49-year-old man on the street near his home in the village of Slobozhanske.
An 82-year-old woman was killed and two men were injured in overnight shelling in Kharkiv city, he wrote on the Telegram app.
A Russian missile attack started a fire at a civilian enterprise in an industrial district of Kharkiv city, injuring four female and two male employees, he added.
In the industrial Dnipropetrovsk region, shelling injured a 57-year-old woman and damaged infrastructure in Nikopol, near the Russian-held Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, regional governor Serhiy Lysak said.
location: Kharkiv and Dnipro regions and the Black Sea port city of Odesa
event_breakdown:
- Russian attacks cause casualties in Kharkiv region:
  - 49-year-old man killed in Slobozhanske
  - 82-year-old woman killed and two men injured in Kharkiv city
  - Fire at a civilian enterprise in industrial district, injuring six employees
- Russian attacks cause casualties in Dnipro region:
  - 57-year-old woman injured in Nikopol
  - Infrastructure damaged in Nikopol
